speaker: ARCHIDAMUS

text_entry: We are tougher, brother,

speaker: LEONTES

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Very sooth, to-morrow.

text_entry: Well said, Hermione.

text_entry: We'll thwack him hence with distaffs.

text_entry: Nay, but you will?

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: I may not, verily.

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Verily!

text_entry: You put me off with limber vows; but I,

text_entry: You shall not go: a lady's 'Verily' 's

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: As potent as a lord's. Will you go yet?

text_entry: Force me to keep you as a prisoner,

speaker: HERMIONE

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: When you depart, and save your thanks. How say you?

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: My prisoner? or my guest? by your dread 'Verily,'

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: One of them you shall be.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Your guest, then, madam:

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: To be your prisoner should import offending;

text_entry: Than you to punish.

text_entry: Not your gaoler, then,

speaker: HERMIONE

text_entry: Of my lord's tricks and yours when you were boys:

text_entry: You were pretty lordings then?

text_entry: But such a day to-morrow as to-day,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: And to be boy eternal.

text_entry: And bleat the one at the other: what we changed

text_entry: O my most sacred lady!

text_entry: Never, but once.

speaker: HERMIONE

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Or I mistake you: O, would her name were Grace!

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: But once before I spoke to the purpose: when?

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Nay, let me have't; I long.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Why, that was when

text_entry: Ere I could make thee open thy white hand

text_entry: 'I am yours for ever.'

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: 'Tis grace indeed.

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: Why, lo you now, I have spoke to the purpose twice:

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: The one for ever earn'd a royal husband;

speaker: HERMIONE
text_entry: The other for some while a friend.

speaker: LEONTES

speaker: LEONTES

text_entry: I may be negligent, foolish and fearful;

speaker: CAMILLO

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: It was my folly; if industriously

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Not weighing well the end; if ever fearful

text_entry: To do a thing, where I the issue doubted,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Where of the execution did cry out

text_entry: Against the non-performance, 'twas a fear

text_entry: Which oft infects the wisest: these, my lord,

text_entry: My present vengeance taken: 'shrew my heart,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: You never spoke what did become you less

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Than this; which to reiterate were sin

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: As deep as that, though true.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Is whispering nothing?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Is leaning cheek to cheek? is meeting noses?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Kissing with inside lip? stopping the career

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Of laughing with a sigh?--a note infallible

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Of breaking honesty--horsing foot on foot?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Skulking in corners? wishing clocks more swift?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Hours, minutes? noon, midnight? and all eyes

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Blind with the pin and web but theirs, theirs only,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That would unseen be wicked? is this nothing?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Why, then the world and all that's in't is nothing;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The covering sky is nothing; Bohemia nothing;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: My wife is nothing; nor nothing have these nothings,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: If this be nothing.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Good my lord, be cured

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Of this diseased opinion, and betimes;

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: For 'tis most dangerous.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Say it be, 'tis true.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: No, no, my lord.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: It is; you lie, you lie:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I say thou liest, Camillo, and I hate thee,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Pronounce thee a gross lout, a mindless slave,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Or else a hovering temporizer, that

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Canst with thine eyes at once see good and evil,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Inclining to them both: were my wife's liver

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Infected as her life, she would not live

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The running of one glass.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Who does infect her?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Why, he that wears her like a medal, hanging

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: About his neck, Bohemia: who, if I

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Had servants true about me, that bare eyes

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To see alike mine honour as their profits,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Their own particular thrifts, they would do that

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Which should undo more doing: ay, and thou,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: His cupbearer,--whom I from meaner form

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Have benched and reared to worship, who mayst see

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Plainly as heaven sees earth and earth sees heaven,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: How I am galled,--mightst bespice a cup,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To give mine enemy a lasting wink;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Which draught to me were cordial.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Sir, my lord,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I could do this, and that with no rash potion,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: But with a lingering dram that should not work

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Maliciously like poison: but I cannot

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Believe this crack to be in my dread mistress,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: So sovereignly being honourable.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I have loved thee,--

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Make that thy question, and go rot!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Dost think I am so muddy, so unsettled,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To appoint myself in this vexation, sully

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The purity and whiteness of my sheets,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Which to preserve is sleep, which being spotted

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Is goads, thorns, nettles, tails of wasps,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Give scandal to the blood o' the prince my son,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Who I do think is mine and love as mine,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Without ripe moving to't? Would I do this?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Could man so blench?

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I must believe you, sir:

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I do; and will fetch off Bohemia for't;

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Provided that, when he's removed, your highness

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Will take again your queen as yours at first,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Even for your son's sake; and thereby for sealing

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: The injury of tongues in courts and kingdoms

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Known and allied to yours.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Thou dost advise me

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Even so as I mine own course have set down:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I'll give no blemish to her honour, none.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: My lord,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Go then; and with a countenance as clear

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: As friendship wears at feasts, keep with Bohemia

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: And with your queen. I am his cupbearer:

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: If from me he have wholesome beverage,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Account me not your servant.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: This is all:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Do't and thou hast the one half of my heart;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Do't not, thou split'st thine own.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I'll do't, my lord.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I will seem friendly, as thou hast advised me.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: O miserable lady! But, for me,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: What case stand I in? I must be the poisoner

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Of good Polixenes; and my ground to do't

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Is the obedience to a master, one

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Who in rebellion with himself will have

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: All that are his so too. To do this deed,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Promotion follows. If I could find example

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Of thousands that had struck anointed kings

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: And flourish'd after, I'ld not do't; but since

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Nor brass nor stone nor parchment bears not one,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Let villany itself forswear't. I must

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Forsake the court: to do't, or no, is certain

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: To me a break-neck. Happy star, reign now!

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Here comes Bohemia.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Re-enter POLIXENES

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: This is strange: methinks

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: My favour here begins to warp. Not speak?

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Good day, Camillo.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Hail, most royal sir!

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: What is the news i' the court?

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: None rare, my lord.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: The king hath on him such a countenance

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: As he had lost some province and a region

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Loved as he loves himself: even now I met him

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: With customary compliment; when he,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Wafting his eyes to the contrary and falling

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: A lip of much contempt, speeds from me and

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: So leaves me to consider what is breeding

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: That changeth thus his manners.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I dare not know, my lord.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: How! dare not! do not. Do you know, and dare not?

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Be intelligent to me: 'tis thereabouts;

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: For, to yourself, what you do know, you must.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: And cannot say, you dare not. Good Camillo,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Your changed complexions are to me a mirror

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Which shows me mine changed too; for I must be

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: A party in this alteration, finding

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Myself thus alter'd with 't.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: There is a sickness

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Which puts some of us in distemper, but

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I cannot name the disease; and it is caught

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Of you that yet are well.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: How! caught of me!

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Make me not sighted like the basilisk:

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: I have look'd on thousands, who have sped the better

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: By my regard, but kill'd none so. Camillo,--

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: As you are certainly a gentleman, thereto

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Clerk-like experienced, which no less adorns

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Our gentry than our parents' noble names,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: In whose success we are gentle,--I beseech you,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: If you know aught which does behove my knowledge

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Thereof to be inform'd, imprison't not

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: In ignorant concealment.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I may not answer.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: A sickness caught of me, and yet I well!

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: I must be answer'd. Dost thou hear, Camillo,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: I conjure thee, by all the parts of man

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Which honour does acknowledge, whereof the least

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Is not this suit of mine, that thou declare

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: What incidency thou dost guess of harm

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Is creeping toward me; how far off, how near;

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Which way to be prevented, if to be;

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: If not, how best to bear it.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Sir, I will tell you;

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Since I am charged in honour and by him

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: That I think honourable: therefore mark my counsel,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Which must be even as swiftly follow'd as

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I mean to utter it, or both yourself and me

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Cry lost, and so good night!

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: On, good Camillo.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I am appointed him to murder you.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: By whom, Camillo?

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: By the king.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: For what?

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: He thinks, nay, with all confidence he swears,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: As he had seen't or been an instrument

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: To vice you to't, that you have touch'd his queen

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Forbiddenly.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: O, then my best blood turn

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: To an infected jelly and my name

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Be yoked with his that did betray the Best!

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Turn then my freshest reputation to

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: A savour that may strike the dullest nostril

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Where I arrive, and my approach be shunn'd,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Nay, hated too, worse than the great'st infection

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: That e'er was heard or read!

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Swear his thought over

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: By each particular star in heaven and

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: By all their influences, you may as well

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Forbid the sea for to obey the moon

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: As or by oath remove or counsel shake

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: The fabric of his folly, whose foundation

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Is piled upon his faith and will continue

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: The standing of his body.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: How should this grow?

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I know not: but I am sure 'tis safer to

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Avoid what's grown than question how 'tis born.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: If therefore you dare trust my honesty,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: That lies enclosed in this trunk which you

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Shall bear along impawn'd, away to-night!

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Your followers I will whisper to the business,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: And will by twos and threes at several posterns

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Clear them o' the city. For myself, I'll put

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: My fortunes to your service, which are here

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: By this discovery lost. Be not uncertain;

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: For, by the honour of my parents, I

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Have utter'd truth: which if you seek to prove,

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: I dare not stand by; nor shall you be safer

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Than one condemn'd by the king's own mouth, thereon

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: His execution sworn.

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: I do believe thee:

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: I saw his heart in 's face. Give me thy hand:

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Be pilot to me and thy places shall

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Still neighbour mine. My ships are ready and

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: My people did expect my hence departure

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Two days ago. This jealousy

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Is for a precious creature: as she's rare,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Must it be great, and as his person's mighty,

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Must it be violent, and as he does conceive

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: He is dishonour'd by a man which ever

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Profess'd to him, why, his revenges must

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: In that be made more bitter. Fear o'ershades me:

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Good expedition be my friend, and comfort

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: The gracious queen, part of his theme, but nothing

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Of his ill-ta'en suspicion! Come, Camillo;

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: I will respect thee as a father if

speaker: POLIXENES
text_entry: Thou bear'st my life off hence: let us avoid.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: It is in mine authority to command

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: The keys of all the posterns: please your highness

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: To take the urgent hour. Come, sir, away.

speaker: CAMILLO
text_entry: Exeunt
